Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2011 03:44AM Kristi_in_MO wrote: My surgeon was a more aggressive one as far as not wanting to wait too long.  I also had a vacation plan that I felt I had truly "earned" after being diagnosed, etc.  At any rate, he didn't want to let me wait, but I ultimately waited about two weeks longer and I personally felt comfortable with that.  His main concern was that even if it is DCIS you never know if a more invasive type could be being camoflouged by it and start metasticizing.  I specifically asked, if it is stage 0 and barely even considered cancer by some docs, why can't I wait.  He said once it becomes invasive you're dealing with something much more serious and you just never know when it will cross that line.  My husband's health insurance was going into effect 2 weeks later and I still went ahead and did the surgery with only my insurance.  I think it is a very personal decision and we will all draw our comfort zones in different places.  Best of luck to you.  You are NOT stupid, just in shock like the rest of us.  Take care.
